docs.snippet: Ryan Schneider, who paid $40,388 for the ball from Georgia Tech’s 220-0 rout of Cumberland 98 years ago, plans to present it to the university....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ryan Schneider, who paid $40,388 for the ball from Georgia Tech’s 220-0 rout of Cumberland 98 years ago, plans to present it to the university.
docs.abstract: Ryan Schneider, Georgia Tech graduate who paid $40,388 for the ball from Georgia Tech’s 220-0 rout of Cumberland in 1916, intends to present the weathered, slightly deflated artifact to the university.

headline.main: Big Score for Georgia Tech, After Alumnus Wins Bid for a Relic
headline.print_headline: Big Score for Georgia Tech After Alum Wins Bid

docs.snippet: The scrubby rangeland and table-top fields of western Kansas have been a fertile source of wheat, soybeans and sorghum and home to one of the nation's largest cattle herds. The region has also been a steady provider of votes for conservative Midwe...
docs.lead_paragraph: The scrubby rangeland and table-top fields of western Kansas have been a fertile source of wheat, soybeans and sorghum and home to one of the nation's largest cattle herds. The region has also been a steady provider of votes for conservative Midwestern Republicans like Pat Roberts.

headline.main: GOP's Roberts Needs Rural Friends More Than Ever

docs.lead_paragraph: The N.B.A.’s new deals with ESPN and Turner Sports will offer more games and highlights and, for fans who have cut the cable cord, more access to viewing.
docs.abstract: NBA's new deals with ESPN and Turner Sports, worth $24 billion over nine years, gives the two media giants the right to stream out-of-market games to fans on the web.

headline.main: ESPN Will Stream Out-of-Market Games on Web as Part of N.B.A. Deal
